Background

Fraser University, Vancouver, Canada, all in Computer Science. In the past, I have worked and visited various 
research and industry institutions, including 
Hong Kong Baptist 
University; Microsoft Research, Asia; NEC Research, New Jersey; CWRU & NASA-Glenn 
Center, Ohio; Teclick Co (start up).

--------------

Recent Research Focus



Internet Architecture and QoS



I am interested in Internet architecture and 
Internet resource utilization problems that can be broadly classified as as 
Quality-of-Service. We study analytic methods, measurement, and pricing 
solutions to make the Internet better.

name: WANGDan
content:
I am currently working on using pricing 
solutions to better match Internet resource supply and demand [SDP'14][INFOCOM'14a][SIGMETRICS'15][INFOCOM'16a].



In the past, I have studied backup paths for 
Internet routing [ICDCS'09][Globecom10], Forwarding (FIB) compression [INFOCOM'11][INFOCOM'14b], Internet routing 
for energy conservation [ICNP'13][INFOCOM'16b],  measurement of Internet 
protocols in high mobility environments [ICNP'14][INFOCOM'15].



I contributed to address 
driven network (ADN), a new architecture, led by Tsinghua University. We studied two dimensional IP 
routing [ICNC'13][INFOCOM'14b][Internetdraft]. More information on this can be 
found .



Smart Building

name: WANGDan
content:
Smart Building



Building is a central point of My study on smart building started from 
wireless sensor networks. In the past, I have studied structural health 
monitoring of high-rise buildings [INFOCOM'10][INFOCOM'12a][TMC'12]. In 
particular, our worked on Guangzhou New TV Tower. More 
information on this can be found .



I am currently focusing on building energy efficiency [INFOCOM'12b][RTSS'13], 
and thermal comfort of people [Buildsys'13][e-Energy'14][Buildsys'14]. It should 
be noted that buildings are constructed to serve people, not to serve energy 
efficiency. Some more information on this can be found .
